docs.snippet: Jailed Saudi blogger Raif Badawi described in his first letter from prison how he "miraculously survived 50 lashes" as part of a conviction that sparked an international outcry, according to German weekly Der Spiegel in a report to be published on...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jailed Saudi blogger Raif Badawi described in his first letter from prison how he "miraculously survived 50 lashes" as part of a conviction that sparked an international outcry, according to German weekly Der Spiegel in a report to be published on Saturday.

headline.main: Saudi Blogger Badawi Views Survival of 50 Lashes as Miracle: Magazine
headline.print_headline: Saudi Blogger Badawi Views Survival of 50 Lashes as Miracle: Magazine

docs.snippet: A former Medford police detective who specialized in investigating elder abuse has been accused of using her expertise to exploit the dementia of a Portland lawyer before his death last year....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former Medford police detective who specialized in investigating elder abuse has been accused of using her expertise to exploit the dementia of a Portland lawyer before his death last year.

headline.main: Daughter Sues Elder Abuse Investigator Over Father's Will
headline.print_headline: Daughter Sues Elder Abuse Investigator Over Father's Will

docs.snippet: The star speaks about returning to the show after more than a decade away....
docs.abstract: The star speaks about returning to the show after more than a decade away.

headline.main: David Duchovny on the New ‘X-Files’ and Why Mulder Was a Terrible F.B.I. Agent

docs.snippet: The prospect of paying for water, which many see as yet another new tax at a time when the government has assured them that austerity is over, has prompted mass protests....
docs.lead_paragraph: The prospect of paying for water, which many see as yet another new tax at a time when the government has assured them that austerity is over, has prompted mass protests.
docs.abstract: Ireland, in effort to resolve its debts, is raising taxes and introducing new ones, latest being water fees; residents, who have been laid off and have seen their health and welfare benefits, are fed up with austerity policies and have begun mass protest campaign.

headline.main: A New Irish Rebellion, This Time Against Water Fees
headline.print_headline: A New Irish Rebellion, This Time Against Water Fees

docs.snippet: Federal investigators met with lawyers for Dr. Salomon Melgen, the wealthy donor who has given gifts to Senator Robert Menendez, whose lawyers have urged the Justice Department not to bring charges....
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal investigators met with lawyers for Dr. Salomon Melgen, the wealthy donor who has given gifts to Senator Robert Menendez, whose lawyers have urged the Justice Department not to bring charges.
docs.abstract: Justice Dept investigators have met with lawyers of Dr Salomon Melgen, close friend of New Jersey Sen Robert Menendez, in attempt to persuade him to cooperate in corruption case they are pursuing against Menendez; deal would make Melgen star witness in case over whether Menendez traded political favors for gifts and lavish vacations.

headline.main: In Menendez Inquiry, Government Renews Push for Friend’s Cooperation
headline.print_headline: Renewed Push for Menendez’s Friend to Cooperate in U.S. Corruption Case

byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington, and Frances Robles from Miami.
